intro: Hieracium dinaricum, commonly known as the Dinaric hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Dinaric Alps region of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium dinaricum is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native environment.
